articles.author: LINDSAY WHITEHURST
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Eleven-year-old Domonic Davis was not far from his mom's Cincinnati home when a hail of gunfire sprayed out from a passing car. Nearly two dozen rounds hurtled through the night at a group of children in the blink of an eye.
articles.title: A surge of illegal homemade machine guns has helped fuel gun violence in the US

articles.author: TERRY TANG
articles.description: TUBA CITY, Ariz. (AP) — Melissa Blackhair is not eager to spring forward Sunday. “I’m dreading it. I just don’t want to see how much we have to adjust," Blackhair said while sitting in her home office in Tuba City on the Navajo Nation, the only area in Arizona that follows daylight saving time.
articles.title: The US is springing forward to daylight saving. For Navajo and Hopi tribes, it's a time of confusion

articles.author: JACK JEFFERY
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — On the eve of the Muslim fasting month of Ramadan, Jerusalem’s Old City bears few of its usual hallmarks of festivity.Nearly half of the grotto-shaped gift shops are sealed behind metal shutters.
articles.title: On eve of Ramadan, Jerusalem’s Old City offers little festivity as Gaza war rages

articles.author: JOSH BOAK and MICHELLE PRICE
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — President Joe Biden said Saturday that he regrets using the term “illegal” during his State of the Union address to describe the suspected killer of Laken Riley, as his all-but-certain 2024 rival Donald Trump blamed Biden for her death at a rally attended by the Georgia nursing student’s family.
articles.title: Biden says he regrets using term 'illegal,' as Trump hosts Laken Riley's family at rally

articles.author: BILL BARROW, JEFF AMY and MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — The 2024 presidential election campaign picked up on Saturday where the 2020 contest left off. Or, more precisely, in a place where it never actually ended.
articles.title: The Biden-Trump rematch comes into view with dueling visits to Georgia

articles.author: LINDSAY WHITEHURST
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Eleven-year-old Domonic Davis was not far from his mom's Cincinnati home when a hail of gunfire sprayed out from a passing car. Nearly two dozen rounds hurtled through the night at a group of children in the blink of an eye.
articles.title: A surge of illegal homemade machine guns has helped fuel gun violence in the US

articles.author: GENE JOHNSON
articles.description: SEATTLE (AP) — The Department of Justice has launched a criminal investigation into the Boeing jetliner blowout that left a gaping hole on an Alaska Airlines plane this January, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday.
articles.title: DOJ opens criminal investigation into the Alaska Airlines 737 plane blowout, report says

articles.author: LEAH WILLINGHAM and KIMBERLEE KRUESI
articles.description: CHARLESTON, W.Va. (AP) — Democrat Kayla Young and Republican Patricia Rucker frequently clash on abortion rights and just about everything else in West Virginia's Legislature, but they agree on one thing: Too few of their colleagues are women, and it's hurting the state.
articles.title: Female representation remains low in US statehouses, particularly Democrats in the South

articles.author: MICHAEL KEALY and BRIAN MELLEY
articles.description: DUBLIN (AP) — Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar conceded defeat Saturday as two constitutional amendments he supported that would have broadened the definition of family and removed language about a woman’s role in the home were headed toward rejection.
articles.title: Irish prime minister concedes defeat in a vote over constitutional amendments about family and women

articles.author: TOM MURPHY
articles.description: Lou Gehrig’s disease took away Grace Armant’s ability to speak, but the 84-year-old still has plenty to say about her insurance.UnitedHealthcare has rejected several requests from her doctors for coverage of a machine Armant needs to breathe as she deals with the fatal illness.
articles.title: Insurer delays and denials hamper patients seeking at-home breathing machines
